title: Meaning of Slope in Speed and Mileage Relationship
question_text: The speed (in kilometers per hour) and mileage (in kilometers per liter) of $13\text{ cars}$ was measured. The regression equation is as follows: $$\text{Mileage (km per liter)}= -1.8 + 0.536 \times \text{Speed (km per hour)}$$ Predictor Coef SE Coef T P Constant -1.8 8.357 -0.22 0.8333 Kilometers per hour 0.536 0.1192 4.5 0.001 According to this model, an increase in speed of $10$ kilometers per hour would change the fuel economy by

choices.text: An increase of 5.36 kilometers per liter 5.36 kilometers per liter .
A decrease of 5.36 kilometers per liter 5.36 kilometers per liter .
A decrease of 1.8 kilometers per liter 1.8 kilometers per liter .
An increase of 0.536 kilometers per liter 0.536 kilometers per liter .
An increase in 8.357 kilometers per liter 8.357 kilometers per liter .
